questions.question: Which was NOT a way the Nile helped the Egyptian civilization develop?

choices.answer: providing a source of food and water
enriching the soil along its banks
protecting against invasion from the west

questions.question: The most fertile soil in Egypt was located in the...
The high position priests held in Egyptian society shows that...

choices.answer: the pharaoh was a descendant of a god
religion was important in Egyptian life
the early Egyptians worshiped many gods

questions.question: The Egyptians are probably best known for building...
What is the Egyptian writing system called?
Which Egyptian ruler's accomplishments were most similar to Sargon's? Hint: Unification
Which of the following was an advantage of Egypt's location?

choices.answer: It had easy access to two rivers systerms
There was plentiful rainfall all year
It was surrounded by powerful kingdoms

questions.question: Which of the following was a result of the Nile's flooding?

choices.answer: Floods destroyed crops and homes, so it was cursed
mud and sand covered the land making it hard to grow crops
people were forced to leave each time the river flooded
the land around the river had rich soil, ideal for farming

questions.question: What was the nickname of Egypt?
What is the best reason describing why ancient Egyptians settled along the Nile?

choices.answer: It provided water and fertile soil for farming
It's geographical features protected them from invaders

questions.question: Egyptian religion focused primarily on...
Who was the leader of Egypt?
What class had the largest number of people?
Why did the Egyptians build the pyramids?
Which of the following statements is NOT true of Egypt's pharaohs?

choices.answer: they were blamed if crops didn't grow
they were chosen by the priests and nobles
they were believed to be gods
they had absolute power over the land and its people

questions.question: What is a ka?

choices.answer: a person's life force or spirit
a letter in the Egyptian alphabet

questions.question: Who are merchants?

choices.answer: people who buy and sell goods
religious priests who chant songs and religious sayings

questions.question: Why is King Tut (a.k.a., King Tutankhamen) important?

choices.answer: He united upper and lower Egypt
He helped Ahmos defeat the Hyksos in the mid-1500's
He was a gret pharaoh with many military conquests
His tomb's treasures helped us learn more about Egyptians

questions.question: Which of these statements is TRUE about polytheism?

choices.answer: There are many gods and goddesses
There is only one major god

questions.question: How did archaeologists learn to read hieroglyphics?

choices.answer: They only read them in one direction
They discovered the Rosetta Stone, which helped decode them

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT true about Egyptian temples?

choices.answer: they had often had colorful paintings inside
Egyptians believed they were the homes of the gods
They often had rows of stone sphinxes leading to entrances
All people and social classes were welcome to enter temples
